What configuration of the BERT network w: A shallow network with a single encoder layer and eight attention heads.
A deep network with multiple encoder layers and sixteen attention heads.
A medium network with two encoder layers and four attention heads.
A wide network with a single encoder layer and twelve attention heads.
What is the main purpose of the NABP-BER: To predict nanobody-antigen binding interactions using sequence information.
To simulate the structural dynamics of nanobody-antigen complexes.
To enhance the expression levels of nanobodies in vitro.
To identify potential off-target effects of nanobodies.
What is the primary advantage of using n: Their small size and ability to bind hidden epitopes.
Their ability to elicit a stronger immune response.
Their higher production yield in bacterial systems.
Their longer half-life in the bloodstream.

Pretraining on viral genome sequences followed by finetuning with antibody binding data.
Pretraining on human antibody sequences followed by finetuning with viral protein data.
Pretraining on bacterial protein sequences followed by finetuning with immune response data.
